instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook A1466 820-00165 PPBUS 0.5V
threads.message:
PP3v42 is ok.
PPBUS_G3H stuck at 0.5V.
Removed the fuse.
Pin 2 is 0.5V and Pin 1 is 1V.

Diode Mode Readings to Ground ( With Fuse Removed)
Pin 2 is 0.452
Pin 1 is 0.003.

threads.title: Macbook A1466 820-00165 PPBUS 0.5V
threads.message: Your problem may be Q7130, or U7100.

threads.title: Macbook A1466 820-00165 PPBUS 0.5V
threads.message:
Diode Mode Reading to Ground

Q7130

CHGR_UGATE 0.002
PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR 0.532
CHGR_LGATE 0.478
CHGR_PHASE IS 0.003



U7100

CHGR_AGATE 0.637
CHGR_DCIN 0.640
CHGR_ACIN 0.540
CHGR-VFRQ 0.497
CHGR_ICOMP 0.732
CHGR_CELL 0.144
CHGR_VCOMP IS 0.734
CHGR_VNEG 0.537
CHGR_AMON 0.737
SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA IS 0.537
SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL IS 0.537


Do you want more readings.

threads.title: Macbook A1466 820-00165 PPBUS 0.5V
threads.message:
NO!
I was expecting you to remove Q7130 and check if short gone off...

threads.title: Macbook A1466 820-00165 PPBUS 0.5V
threads.message:
C7140 as broken. repalced it. Machine now switches on. I can use the mouse and input the password when it switches on the first time. Post that the keyboard and mouse stop working. The on/ff switch works though.

Very weird.

threads.title: Macbook A1466 820-00165 PPBUS 0.5V
threads.message: Check all TPAD_SPI resistors and traces.

threads.title: Macbook A1466 820-00165 PPBUS 0.5V
threads.message: Q3088 was coroded. Cleaned it. Issue Resolved.
